DataElement.preferredDefinition: Statistical characterization of human populations using an examination of a patient's medical history in relation to smoking tobacco.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Statistical characterization of human populations using an examination of a patient's medical history in relation to smoking tobacco.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: statistical characterization of human populations (or segments of human populations broken down by age or sex or income etc.).

Concepts.definition: The statistical characterization of human populations or segments of human populations (e.g., characterization by age, sex, race, or income).

Property.preferredDefinition: The leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, dried and prepared for smoking or ingestion.:An examination of a patient's medical history in relation to smoking.

Concepts.definition: The dried cured leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, used for smoking, chewing, or snuff.  Tobacco contains nicotine, a stimulant, and other biologically active ingredients having carcinogenic properties.
A record of an individual's background in regard to smoking tobacco. This would include such factors as start date, end date (if applicable), number of cigarette smoked, attempts to quit, and others.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The codes that describe an examination of a patient's medical history in relation to smoking tobacco.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, dried and prepared for smoking or ingestion.:An examination of a patient's medical history in relation to smoking.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The dried cured leaves of the tobacco plant, Nicotiana tabacum, used for smoking, chewing, or snuff.  Tobacco contains nicotine, a stimulant, and other biologically active ingredients having carcinogenic properties.
A record of an individual's background in regard to smoking tobacco. This would include such factors as start date, end date (if applicable), number of cigarette smoked, attempts to quit, and others.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences
